# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @return {Integer}
def missing_integer(nums)
  # Sort the nums to ensure we can easily find sequential numbers
  nums.sort!
  # Initialize variables to keep track of the current sum and the longest prefix sum
  current_sum = 0
  longest_prefix_sum = 0
  previous_num = nil

  nums.each_with_index do |num, index|
    if index == 0
      # For the first element, just set the base for comparison
      current_sum = num
      previous_num = num
      longest_prefix_sum = current_sum
    else
      if num == previous_num + 1
        # If the current number is sequential, add it to the current sum
        current_sum += num
        previous_num = num
        # Update the longest prefix sum if the current is longer
        longest_prefix_sum = current_sum if current_sum > longest_prefix_sum
      elsif num != previous_num
        # Reset current sum if the number is not a direct sequence and not a duplicate
        current_sum = num
        previous_num = num
      end
    end
  end

  # The smallest missing integer is initially the next integer after the longest prefix sum
  missing_integer = longest_prefix_sum + 1
  
  # If the missing integer is in the array, keep incrementing until we find one that's not
  while nums.include?(missing_integer)
    missing_integer += 1
  end
  
  missing_integer
end
